definition: to/for/for the benefit of/to give/to allow/to do sth (for sb)/(grammatical equivalent of 被)/(grammatical equivalent of 把)/(sentence intensifier)
"silk" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 120), occurring in 红, 绿, 累 etc/also pr. [mi4]
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]
to send/to give as a present
to furnish/to provide/supply (as in supply and demand)
to show deference or praise publicly

sentences.english: After that, people call on their relatives, friends and neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 在那之後，人們給親戚，朋友和鄰居拜年。

sentences.english: No problem is permanent storms always give way to the sun.
sentences.chinese: 風暴總會給陽光讓路，寒冬總會轉變爲暖春。

sentences.english: Boy stole a lesson-book from one of his school-fellows and took it home to his Mother.
sentences.chinese: 有個男孩偷了同學的一本教科書，帶回家給母親。

sentences.english: He was supposed to give us advice, but this ideas were airy-fairy ideas.
sentences.chinese: 他應該給我們提些勸告，但他的主意都是不切實際的。

sentences.english: The peeled eggs are completely natural and provide customers with convenience and ease of use.
sentences.chinese: 白煮採用提桶或真空包裝，給用戶提供方便和快捷。

sentences.english: Well cook dumplings with seafood for you.
sentences.chinese: 我們煮海鮮水餃給你喫。

sentences.english: That apparently made quite an impression on the president's young daughter.
sentences.chinese: 着很顯然給總統的小女兒留下了很深的印象。

sentences.english: He bought her a gift at the duty-free shop.
sentences.chinese: 他在免稅商店裏給她買了份禮物。

sentences.english: Give them a call and hang out sometime.
sentences.chinese: 給他們打個電話，約個時間出去逛逛吧。

sentences.english: Hooley 's Irish Pub brings an authentic slice of Irish culture to Guangzhou.
sentences.chinese: 胡利的愛爾蘭酒吧給廣州帶來了真正的愛爾蘭文化片。

sentences.english: He is determined to devote his life to sicence.
sentences.chinese: 他決心把畢生精力貢獻給科學事業。

sentences.english: One day Mrs. Slaton gave the class an assignment.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，斯萊頓夫人給全班同學佈置了一項作業。

sentences.english: A software company might give bonuses to programmers who create the fewest bugs .
sentences.chinese: 一個軟件公司可以加發獎勵給寫出最少臭蟲的程序員。

sentences.english: Give them some money to take their younger siblings out for ice cream.
sentences.chinese: 給他們些零花錢，讓他帶着他的弟妹們去買些冷飲。

sentences.english: The guide misled the tourists in the woods.
sentences.chinese: 嚮導在森林裏給旅遊者帶錯了路。

sentences.english: Make your records available to the local and national record committees.
sentences.chinese: 將自己的紀錄提供給地區或是全國性的紀錄委員會。

definition: to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])
to help/to assist/to support/for sb (i.e. as a help)/hired (as worker)/side (of pail, boat etc)/outer layer/upper (of a shoe)/group/gang/clique/party/secret society
still/still in progress/still more/yet/even more/in addition/fairly/passably (good)/as early as/even/also/else
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
to send/to give as a present
to press charges/to file a complaint
should/ought to/probably/must be/to deserve/to owe/to be sb's turn to do sth/that/the above-mentioned
plural marker for pronouns, and nouns referring to individuals
this/these/(commonly pr. [zhei4] before a classifier, esp. in Beijing)
right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple
